name: Common Cold
description: The common cold is a viral infection affecting the nose and throat. It usually causes runny nose, sneezing, congestion, and mild discomfort, and typically resolves within 7–10 days.

mild.definition: Mild cold symptoms with short duration

moderate.definition: Cold symptoms lasting several days requiring monitoring

high_risk.definition: Cold symptoms with respiratory or systemic danger signs

criteria.other_symptoms: breathing difficulty, chest pain, severe weakness

self_care: Drink warm fluids like soups and herbal teas
Use steam inhalation to relieve nasal congestion
Gargle with warm salt water for throat irritation
Maintain good hygiene to prevent spread

medicines.name: Cetirizine 10mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of sneezing and runny nose

urgent: ear pain or severe sinus pain
doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if cold symptoms persist beyond 10 days or are associated with breathing difficulty, chest pain, or severe weakness.

assessment_questions.question: How many days have you had these cold symptoms?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek medical care for severe or worsening cold symptoms.
